intro: Lesquerella gracilis, commonly known as the slender lesquerella, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard plants, and is characterized by its small, yellow flowers and linear leaves. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. Lesquerella gracilis produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. It is of interest to botanists and conservationists due to its limited distribution and ecological significance.
